intro: Jamesbrittenia glutinosa, commonly known as the sticky jellyplant, is a unique member of the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its fleshy, gelatinous stems and leaves that exude a sticky substance when disturbed. Native to the arid regions of southern Africa, this plant has adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments. Its sticky secretions serve as a defense mechanism against herbivores and help retain moisture. The plant's unusual appearance and adaptive features make it a fascinating subject in botanical studies.
